title: Firewall Detective
description:
Review these iptables firewall log entries. What destination port was the attacker scanning that got BLOCKED?

[FIREWALL-ALLOW] IN=eth0 SRC=192.168.1.100 DST=10.0.0.5 PROTO=TCP SPT=44321 DPT=80 ACK
[FIREWALL-ALLOW] IN=eth0 SRC=192.168.1.100 DST=10.0.0.5 PROTO=TCP SPT=44322 DPT=443 ACK
[FIREWALL-DROP] IN=eth0 SRC=10.10.14.99 DST=10.0.0.5 PROTO=TCP SPT=55123 DPT=3389 SYN
[FIREWALL-DROP] IN=eth0 SRC=10.10.14.99 DST=10.0.0.5 PROTO=TCP SPT=55124 DPT=22 SYN
[FIREWALL-ALLOW] IN=eth0 SRC=192.168.1.100 DST=10.0.0.5 PROTO=TCP SPT=44323 DPT=80 ACK

Which service was the attacker (10.10.14.99) trying to reach on DPT=3389?

Submit as: flag{service_name} (lowercase, full protocol name)
hints: DPT=3389 is a well-known Windows service port
This protocol allows remote graphical access to a computer
